subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In the historical {{w|Jiyun}} 《{{w2|zh|集韻}}》 dictionary, the vertical {{l|mul|丨}} stroke at the middle of {{l|mul|果}} is written with a vertical {{l|mul|亅}} hook instead.
* In the historical {{w|Longkan Shoujian}} 《{{w2|zh|龍龕手鑑}}》 dictionary, the bottom component of {{l|mul|果}} is written similar to {{l|mul|朩}}.

subSections.title: Glyph 1
subSections.text: ''This section refers to the standard glyph form.''

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=kè
|c=fo3 <!-- Note: Pronunciation "gwo2" belongs to Glyph 2, Etymology 1 -->
|mc=
|oc=
|cat=n
}}

subSections.title: Glyph 2
subSections.text: ''This section refers to the historical glyph form where the vertical {{l|mul|丨}} stroke at the middle of {{l|mul|果}} is written with a vertical {{l|mul|亅}} hook instead. Note that the two glyph forms are considered identical in modern usage.

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
Found in the {{w|Jiyun}} 《{{w2|zh|集韻}}》 {{w|rime dictionary}} published during the {{w|Song dynasty}} (1037 AD) and {{w|Longkan Shoujian}} 《{{w2|zh|龍龕手鑑}}》 dictionary compiled in 997 AD.

{{Han compound|金|果|c1=s|c2=p|t1=gold; metal|ls=psc|no_och2=1}}.

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: Found in the historical {{w|Jiyun}} 《{{w2|zh|集韻}}》 {{w|rime dictionary}} published during the {{w|Song dynasty}} and <big>《重訂直音篇》</big> published during the {{w|Ming dynasty}}.
